result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Orville Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond to be applied to costs.

Domestic violence treatment and follow through.

No contact with A.T. or her residence except as approved by agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

DEFENDANT ENTITLED TO 2 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT IF PROBATION IS REVOKED.
